授業方法: This course consists of weekly routine activities (reading, journal entry on LUNA, and class discussions), one experiment report, one interview paper, and a term reflection paper. Active participation in class discussions and regular monitoring of LUNA are expected. The schedule below is subject to change.

第1回:
Weekly Routine: Students will complete assigned readings (typically 2-3 articles) and post a reading journal entry on LUNA prior to each class meeting.

Multi-Week Projects: Students will write one experiment report (Norm-Breaking Experiment Report) and one interview paper (Deviant Identity Interview Paper). Students will conduct these projects outside of class.
第2回:
Part 1. Boundaries and Deviance
1-1.    What is Deviance?: Three Perspectives
第4回: 1-3.    The Power of Belonging: Insights from Three Experiments
第6回:
Part II. Stigma and Stigma Management
2-1. Stigma: The Concept
第14回: Term Reflection Paper due one week after the last class meeting
